column4: So my processor runs approx. 10 degrees warmer in Ubuntu than it does in XP
so that the fan is on nearly constantly.
I already have frequency scaling set up.
you are confusing me, when you get  100% cpu , open a terminal and type top,  see what process is on top of the list
that's the thing.  there's nothing listed in top that's eating CPU cycles... it just seems to be unrelated to ANYthing
try with sudo top , might bring up more processes
I don't mean to be difficult, but I've tried that.
could it be the display that is wrong ? is  your system behaving as if is it using 100% cpu &
now THAT sounds like a very good possibility!  In top and sudo top, nothing shows as chewing up 100% CPU, but in gnome-system-monitor, it shows 100% CPU usage w/o any apps eating that much CPU
in system-monitor when you turn it on , the sys-mon itself does take quite a bit of cpu to get running , but it tends to go up and down for a while
alas, it's not just with system mon.
there is a pannel app you can use to monitor your cpu and mem and a bunch of otehr suff that you can basicaly ahve on all the time, that might give you a better idea
sensors-applet  might need to apt-get it first
all right.  I'll look into it
make a crontab rule to restart the screenlets every hour
It's probabaly a memory leak in the way screenlets is coded,   you'll need to check in their forum for a clue
ah, gotcha... all righty.  I appreciate the Crontab rule hint.
